replies.body:
It doesn't matter who started it. It doesn't matter what you were responding to. It only matters what you said. In order for you to understand this, I recommend removing your name from the logs, and then looking at them *by themselves*. Would those logs be punishable if they were some random person and nobody else said anything that game? If so, then yes, your logs were punishable.

By the way, continually calling people kids, saying they can't read, arguing, and calling them a "fking retard" is certainly punishable.

> By the way, continually calling people kids, saying they can't read, arguing, and calling them a "fking retard" is certainly punishable.

mmmmm, defiantly understand their opinion on this but I guess mine is just different.
I'd argue that calling people kids because of their behavior and telling them they can't read in response to them saying "I'm not reading your paragraph," isn't really toxic. "Fking retard," defiantly yes, thus only said it once. But honestly, Our team got it pretttttttty bad.
Something is ether toxic or not. It doesn't change it's toxicity by being in response to something.

Yes, they do read it. And it wasn't just for calling him retarded. It was *constant* toxicity and negativity.

No, they don't give a shit about context. And they never will. They explicitly stated they never will.

And what happens when you decide to not "take it like a bitch?  They flame you back, you get indignant and say more stuff, so they flame even more, etc. 

It doesn't help your team win, it doesn't help stop toxicity, and it is honestly just silly.  "Why did you say all these atrocious things" "BECAUSE HE SAID MEAN THINGS FIIIIIRST..."
Responding to insults with insults of your own doesn't exempt you from the rules.
